_source.title: Sales Engineer, Channel
_source.description_short: Duo’s SE team is a makeup of customer centric engineers that love providing prospects and customers with an amazing experience. We are focused on ensu...
_source.description:
Duo’s SE team is a makeup of customer centric engineers that love providing prospects and customers with an amazing experience. We are focused on ensuring technical success with Duo. We work as a team to improve and strengthen our technical and sales skills. We believe in the importance of making a large impact at Duo by working closely with our customers, sales, product, engineering, R&D, marketing, support and customers success teams.

We’re looking for a Channel-specific Sales Engineer to support our growing partner/business development team!

So what does a day in the life of a Sales Engineer at Duo look like?

Expect to work hard and have fun. Duo’s SaaS security solution breaks the mold of the traditional sales model allowing us to move sales cycles at a much higher velocity.  A Channel SE will work with many, many prospects and partners  in a day providing consulting, technical training, technical implementation and demos of Duo. We partner with our Channel Account Managers  to understand and align with our partners’ needs, develop and deliver the technical enablement to partners, and consult through cutting edge security strategies. We are extremely responsive and available to ensure our prospects and partners have an amazing experience with Duo.

In order to be successful in this role, you must have a passion for technology and love Duo.

Before applying for this position, you should sign-up for Duo and try the product for yourself. We challenge you to setup RDP or SSH in under 10 minutes. Experience why Duo’s customers are so passionate about us that we’ve been called the “The Most Loved Company in Security”.

Sales Skills

  • Ability to align partner needs and strategy with the value of Duo’s Trusted Access Vision
  • Provide unbelievable product demos
  • Provide incredible technical enablement and training to strategic partners
  • Position Duo against competing products
  • Strategically position Duo with other technologies sold by partners
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Work as a team with your assigned Channel Account Manager
  • 3+ Years of Channel SE experience in a role supporting Enterprise software, SaaS and/or security

Technical Skills

Network Engineering Experience

  • Extensive IP network troubleshooting skills including active working knowledge of tools and commands like ping, traceroute, nslookup and wireshark.
  • SSLVPN configuration on devices such as Juniper, Cisco, F5, Palo Alto Networks, CheckPoint, Cisco ASA, etc.
  • Able to quickly diagnose network configuration issues
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of Active Directory, LDAP and RADIUS authentication

Systems Engineering Experience

  • Has setup and configured Active Directory
  • Working knowledge of LDAP with ability to troubleshoot LDAP lookup issues
  • Has setup and configured Active Directory with strong knowledge of Windows Server
  • Has experience working with Microsoft Exchange
  • Has a working knowledge of Office 365
  • Has configured and troubleshooted SAML and SSO
  • Familiar with Unix and Linux, Especially SSH
  • Knowledgeable with Identity/Access Management and two-factor authentication

Excited? We can't wait to hear from you!

_source.title: Full Stack Engineer - Apps
_source.description_short: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today, Cloudflare runs one of the world’s largest...
_source.description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today, Cloudflare runs one of the world’s largest distributed networks that powers more than 1.5 trillion page views each month across 6.5 million Internet properties. More than 10 percent of all global Internet requests flow through Cloudflare’s network. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code.

Our team is hard at work shaping the future of the Internet by solving some of its toughest challenges. We believe in solving real problems by granting individuals and teams ownership and autonomy. If you want to make the Internet better by working with talented coworkers to solve hard problems at scale, Cloudflare is where you belong.

About the Department

Cloudflare Apps is building the next billion-dollar app marketplace from the ground up. Rather than mobile phones, our apps get installed onto Cloudflare-powered websites. Visit https://cloudflare.com/apps to preview apps and try your hand at building one.

The way tools are installed onto websites and Internet properties is outdated. We believe an engineer should be able to build and monetize the next great analytics, security, or even e-commerce solution and offer it to millions of sites overnight.  If what she builds is the best solution, it should be possible for her to make millions of dollars too.

To make that dream possible we’ve built more than just a listing of apps. Cloudflare Apps can be customized, previewed, and installed onto any site in the Cloudflare network securely and reliably. Our aim is to make it possible for Cloudflare Apps to control every aspect of a request, and for the platform to be beloved across the Internet — from personal blogs to the world’s largest enterprises.

Responsibilities

As a member of our growing team of engineers your responsibilities include:

  • Ship product features to the millions of sites which use Cloudflare every day.
  • Be an entrepreneur and a visionary for your portion of the platform. Take responsibility for ensuring that what you build delights customers and achieves the goals of the team and the organization.
  • Write in any or all of Javascript, CSS, and Go, based on your interest and experience.
  • Work with talented peers by submitting and reviewing pull requests, engaging in design discussions, and teaming up to tackle new projects.
  • Advocate for how the product and the team can work better.

Members of our team are responsible for:

  • Building APIs which are both simple and powerful allowing app developers to build tools utilizing more of Cloudflare and more of the web browser.
  • Improving the experience of installing a Cloudflare App. This includes tools like our Live App Preview, our app listing, ratings, reviews and app recommendations.
  • Creating tools and dashboards to support app creators. This includes tools for app creators to get more feedback from users, to get analytics on their app’s success, and to have a better experience creating and debugging their apps.
  • Working with app creators to see that their apps are easy to use, well designed, and secure.
  • Building open source projects to share what we learn and share the power and value of Cloudflare Apps.

Key Competencies

You are user-focused and thrive in a fast-paced and goal-driven environment. You consider building reliable and capable software to be just the first step in solving user problems. You are confident building software which works reliably because you’ve made many of the mistakes already. You’d rather ship than overengineer. You have a passion for growing yourself and your teammates and always have your sights set on getting better. You strive to have a positive impact and leave a positive impression on everyone you meet. You want to be a part of building something you can be proud of.

This job can adapt to your knowledge and interest in backend development, frontend development, design, and growth. Core experience should include:

  • 5+ years of experience developing for the web
  • Experience with Go (or similar languages), Javascript, and/or CSS
  • Track record of shipping features which work.
  • Great communication skills
  • A kind and generous attitude towards customers and coworkers alike

Bonus Points

  • An appreciation and understanding of unit and integration testing
  • Experience with React and/or Angular
  • Experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL
  • Experience building APIs which enable others to build great things
  • Experience with using analytics and A/B testing to power growth in users and revenue

What Makes Us Special

We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company, we also have a soul. Our vision is driven by a belief that the Internet should be fair and open to all. Without the protection of Cloudflare thousands of sites, including many non-profits, would not be able to stay online. We not only provide our highest level of protection free to many of these advocacy and human rights organizations, we also provide a free tier of service to every site on the Internet which choses to use Cloudflare. If you believe in a free and open Internet, Cloudflare is the right place for you.

This job is available in both Austin, TX and San Francisco, CA. Relocation assistance will be provided. Cloudflare is a security company. A successful background check is required for employment.

Cloudflare hires the best people based on an evaluation of their abilities and effectiveness.  We don't discriminate against employees on the basis of any other personal characteristic or any classification protected by federal, state or local law.

_source.title: Sales Development Representative
_source.description_short: We're looking for talented Sales Development Representatives who will be responsible for identifying and qualifying sales opportunities in North Ameri...
_source.description:
We're looking for talented Sales Development Representatives who will be responsible for identifying and qualifying sales opportunities in North America. The role focuses on identifying the business need while also conducting information-gathering to help pre-qualify opportunities for the sales organization through phone and email contact. 
 
Responsibilities

  • Identify qualified sales opportunities in both small & medium size businesses and enterprise accounts
  • Interact with IT and business decision makers via telephone and email
  • Update lead and prospect activity in Salesforce to ensure effective lead management
  • Set qualified introductory meetings for the sales team
  • Nurture early phase opportunities for future pipeline potential
  • Exceed weekly, monthly, quarterly lead development quota

Requirements 

  • 1+ years Sales/Lead Generation experience
  • Proven track record of achieving and exceeding measurable goals in a highly automated metrics based phone sales environment
  • Must possess strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Be a team player with high energy
  • Be self-motivated and have the ability to thrive in a result-oriented environment
  • College degree or equivalent work experience
  • Sales training and Salesforce.com experience a plus

_source.title: Seasonal Sales Ambassador - The Domain
_source.description_short: Position: Seasonal Sales Ambassador   Ever wondered what it’s like behind the bubbles?  #lushcareers Lush North America has been creating fresh and h...
_source.description:
Position: Seasonal Sales Ambassador

 

Ever wondered what it’s like behind the bubbles?  #lushcareers

Lush North America has been creating fresh and handmade cosmetics for the past 20 years- keeping our customers’ bathtubs and showers a little more magical through our retail shops across Canada and the US. We are dedicated to the practices of fair trade sourcing and supporting sustainable communities as well as giving back to organizations that can make a difference through our Charity Pot Program.

Each holiday season we rely on thousands of Seasonal Sales Ambassadors to bring our products to life for our customers and make their holiday shopping experience a unique and memorable one. In return we offer extensive training in our product ranges, a generous 50% discount, and motivating bonus opportunities. Our stores are fun, fast-paced and interactive – we’d love for you to apply!

As a Seasonal Sales Ambassador at Lush you bring enthusiasm and passion for the Lush brand through a fresh and authentic customer, staff, and shop experience.

 

We Offer:

  • A fun and funky store atmosphere where individualism is encouraged
  • A 50% discount off all our products to keep you smelling and feeling fresh
  • The opportunity for growth as Lush loves to promote from within

 

Responsibilities:

Customer Experience: Ensure a unique customer experience that makes every visitor feel welcome, meets their needs and makes their day. Offer a tailored customer experience through active listening, genuine curiosity, and expert brand and product knowledge.

Team Involvement: Show up to each shift with a positive attitude and ready to contribute to the team. Be present in driving your own development and constantly look to grow and elevate your skills and add to a solution-oriented work environment.

Operational Excellence: Help create and maintain an inviting shop atmosphere with fresh product, beautiful displays and efficient and accurate processes that support an environment of excellence and lives the Lush values.

Qualifications:

Required:

  • Can lift to 30 lbs; reasonable accommodations will be made for any employee when necessary
  • Ability to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the shop

Preferred:

  • Experience in customer service
  • Experience working in a team environment

 

At LUSH, we believe when we continue to foster a culture of inclusion and respect within a diverse workforce, we are doing our part in building a world where there is equal opportunity for all. We recruit from a variety of employment agencies, community groups, non-profits, and online social and job sites, and in our business practices, strive to leverage the gift that diversity brings.   
 
LUSH North America unequivocally supports equal opportunity employment for all applicants regardless of religion, race, color,  gender identity or expression,  sexual orientation, ancestry,  differently abled, adverse mental health, and other characteristics both defined, protected and enforced by the law under federal or provincial/state jurisdiction.

_source.title: Deal Desk Analyst
_source.description_short: We are Duo, and we’re here to democratize security for everyone. Our mission is to protect the mission of our customers like Facebook, Twitter, Kayak ...
_source.description:
We are Duo, and we’re here to democratize security for everyone. Our mission is to protect the mission of our customers like Facebook, Twitter, Kayak and Etsy by making security simple.

 

We’re a diverse crew of makers and builders, skaters and coders, filmmakers and DJs, teachers and students brought together by a shared belief in adding value to the world. This diversity allows us to bring an empathetic approach to solve some of the most complex global business and security challenges faced today.

What you’ll do…

As a  Deal Desk Analyst  you’ll be responsible for drafting non-standard Duo Sales Order Forms (OFs) that meet our internal booking and revenue recognition (GAAP) policies.  The Deal Desk Analyst will also assist AEs in structuring deals to maximize the annual contract value (ACV) for Duo.  This role will also assist with auditing and processing sales Order Forms, credit card subscription maintenance and subscription license fulfillment.   

 

Skills you have…

  • 2+ years experience reviewing, drafting, and negotiating commercial terms for SaaS agreements and/or related Order Forms, restatements, amendments
  • High energy professional who is passionate about partnering with our sales teams to close deals for Duo
  • Enjoys working in a fast growing, ever changing environment of a hyper growth technology company
  • Experience in software & SaaS industries a plus
  • Excellent responsiveness to internal and external stakeholders
  • Experience detecting revenue recognition / GAAP issues on sales orders
  • Exceptional communication skills; excellent stakeholder engagement skills with Sales, Finance, and Legal
  • Ability to understand how non standard Terms and Conditions impact the business and revenue recognition  
  • Experience working in a high volume order transaction processing environment and being able to deliver with a good attitude
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize work
  • Experience working in Salesforce.com (required)
  • Experience working in Steelbrick / Salesforce CPQ (strongly desired)
  • Experience working in Recurly or other credit card transaction processing software (desired but not required)
  • Proficiency in standardized software applications, such as Microsoft Office, Gmail, Google Docs, and Google Sheets



Reasons why you should apply…

You will be the Deal Desk commercial expert partnering with Duo Legal and Finance departments in support of the  sales organization to advise them on how to win the right deal for Duo.

 

You bring a winning “can do” attitude to work.

You lean into challenging situations.

You embrace and seek innovation.

You build collaborative relationships up, down, and across the organization.



This job may not be for you if...

You don’t thrive on a  demanding nature of working in a fast paced sales organization and engaging with many types of personalities while maintaining a positive, professional attitude and communication in all situations.

 

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

_source.title: Senior Backend Engineer (NodeJS)
_source.description_short: Tenfold is seeking a Senior Backend Software Engineer to help influence and build our sales analytics and productivity suite of products. We are looki...
_source.description:
Tenfold is seeking a Senior Backend Software Engineer to help influence and build our sales analytics and productivity suite of products. We are looking for well-rounded back-end or full stack engineers who are passionate about building and delivering reliable, scalable microservices and infrastructure for cloud and on-premise product delivery.

Built for enterprises and high-growth companies, Tenfold helps companies increase revenue and build better relationships with their customers by allowing them to measure, analyze and improve every aspect of the customer journey.  Our software connects a company’s existing phone system with any CRM or system of record.  Tenfold optimizes the way companies sell, service and support their customers, while enabling them to measurably improve the customer experience.  Tenfold helps companies open customer relationships that will continue to grow and create value over time, while at the same time enabling them to retain these relationships by providing an exceptional customer experience.  Tenfold’s enterprise clients are connecting their phone systems with an average of nine different systems of record.

Watch our demo video - https://vimeo.com/198699478

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement REST-based microservices in Node.js
  • Play a critical role in all architecture, coding, testing, and deployment decisions
  • Produce engineering specifications, delivery estimates, and implement solutions based on product requirements
  • Collaborate with peers on specifications, code reviews, and testing
  • Produce unit and automated end-to-end tests to improve code quality and maximize code coverage for new and existing features

Requirements

  • 5 years of professional software development experience
  • Node.js or Python experience; Node.js prefered as that is our primary development language
  • NoSQL database experience
  • Experience with large volumes of data and rigorous processing time constraints
  • Great communication skills
  • BS in Computer Science or commensurate industry experience

Preferred

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud
  • Experience with machine learning
  • Experience with Continuous Integration and Delivery
  • Experience instrumenting code for gathering production performance metrics

The Perks & Benefits

  • Competitive salaries
  • Stock Options (become an owner in the company)
  • Incentive compensation based on successful attainment of measured goals
  • Employee medical and dental coverage
  • Short and long-term disability
  • Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Generous vacation time
  • 24/7 parking near UT Campus in Austin
  • Rapidly growing organization poised for growth and career development
  • A beautiful office space with lots of natural lighting
  • Exciting customer base and quality opportunities for advancement
  • Austin Hottest Startups Watch list
  • Austin A-List best businesses in Growth phase

_source.title: Sales Enablement Program Manager - Americas
_source.description_short: Role Description   The Role: The primary emphasis of the Sales Enablement Program Manager role is to partner with the Americas sales leadership and o...
_source.description:
Role Description

The Role: The primary emphasis of the Sales Enablement Program Manager role is to partner with the Americas sales leadership and other relevant groups to develop and deliver a compelling, effective programs that will help set up the sales organization for success during their tenure at Dropbox.  This role will be a key stakeholder within the Sales Enablement organization that is tasked with deploying productivity strategies that will help the business scale and grow. This role will play an important part in helping to shape the conversation about the future state and structure of the Americas sales organization, and the people and processes needed to maintain long-term effectiveness.
 
You: Self starter; comfortable with executing in a methodical and creative manner on defined goals, success factors, and key metrics. You love to innovate and execute in a rapidly changing environment, are results oriented, and are passionate about “sweating the details” to help the Americas sales team build their skills and exceed their targets.  You will be responsible for managing and driving enablement activity across our teams, ensuring that we are supporting their critical needs at a time of exciting business transformation. 

Responsibilities

  • Understand the training needs of the Americas sales teams to create and implement innovative, just-in-time enablement tools and techniques to that will decrease knowledge and skills gaps in our Sales org
  • Act as the voice of Sales, engage internal stakeholders to develop and deliver iterative training, and continually refresh content based on Sales needs, industry trends, product value and capabilities, competitive positioning, and internal processes
  • Work with Marketing to create and highlight case studies, sales guides, competitive fact sheets, and other compelling content assets, both internal and external, to support sales teams and advance deals
  • Using various appropriate training methods and media, enable Sales team on best use of marketing and enablement materials, positioning, value proposition, audience, competitive etc
  • Provide operational, logistic and organizational support for the Americas Productivity team, communicate regular progress/status to key stakeholders in Enablement and Sales, and manage resources and project teams as needed
  • Help ensure programs are delivered on time and at the highest levels of quality
  • Help organize quarterly Americas Sales Kickoffs and build content in partnership with Sales Leadership

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in Sales enablement/productivity and program management
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Executive presence, and proven ability to establish credibility with senior leadership
  • Ability to deliver content in an engaging and compelling manner
  • Hands-on content creation experience required
  • Deep understanding of structure and requirements of outbound sales organizations, experience with sales curricula development
  • Detailed knowledge of SaaS sales cycles; quota carrying experience a definite plus (sales, or a support function like solution architect/consultant)
  • Demonstrated ability to establish and manage project priorities and timelines to achieve results
  • Excellent coordination and operational expertise
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of Salesforce preferred
  • Eligibility to work in the US 
  • Minimal travel required (10 - 15%)

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time off 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

_source.title: Web App Developer
_source.description_short: We're looking for a passionate, results-oriented, Software Engineer to build and maintain our industry-leading healthcare web applications. The ideal ...
_source.description:
We're looking for a passionate, results-oriented, Software Engineer to build and maintain our industry-leading healthcare web applications. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment and has the ability to grasp complex software engineering concepts and learn new technologies quickly. As a Software Engineer at Kinnser Software you will work as a member of a Scrum team to architect, build, and test the latest features and enhancements to our software. You will work in an environment that emphasizes collaboration, automation, and performance.  You will require little management because you can solve most problems on your own and know how to effectively communicate with peers and various stakeholders.  

What You’ll be doing:

As a developer, you’ll be playing a key role in building large-scale public-facing, high-volume web applications. You will architect, plan, and build new systems that are high performing and well tested. At Kinnser, we’re not afraid of change and improvement. That’s why we expect you to make recommendations for automation improvements and actually implement these recommendations. You’ll also perform code reviews, and you will write unit and integration tests. We’ll also help to develop you as an engineer; we’ll provide you with the tools and education to ensure your growth.

What we’re looking for:

Our engineering team is made up of really smart and diverse team members, but we all share the same goal, and that is to make applications that are functional and easy to use for healthcare professionals. We’re looking for seasoned developers with a very analytical mindset. Our most successful new hires tend to have already been working a number of years doing front-end and server-side web development. You should also not be a novice to JavaScript.  Hopefully you’ve been mastering the craft a few years now. We use Github, so version control software experience is going to be a major plus for us. We run an Agile shop.  It’s important to us that you have an understanding of this as well as software development principals. We have a highly collaborative culture, and we’re always learning from each other, but don’t be surprised if you have to work on a solo project from time to time.

Experience and qualities that we’re definitely interested in:

• AngularJS (Single Page Applications)
• NodeJS
• REST API development
• Experience writing tests and doing automation
• Experience with extremely large, high-traffic, OLTP databases
• Experience with SQL and NoSQL
• You've worked in the healthcare industry
• JSON

• Strong .NET skills

About Kinnser 

We deliver easy-to-use, agency management software backed by our top-rated services teams. Our mission is to help our customers provide the best in patient care and thrive as businesses.  Today, we focus on hospice as well as home health and are planning to work across the post-acute care continuum.  Headquartered in Austin, Texas, we serve more than 3,000 agencies across the US, and we’re recognized as one of the fastest growing tech companies by Inc 500 Magazine. We know great products and service start with great people, and we’re proud to be named a “Top Place to Work” in the annual Austin American Statesman workplace survey. With Kinnser’s point of care solutions, home health and hospice agencies can more effectively manage their scheduling, billing, compliance, electronic visit verification, and physician referrals.

_source.title: Agency Sales Director - EMEA
_source.description_short: Job Summary:  As an Agency Sales Director (SD), you will be a passionate overachiever with an entrepreneurial spirit and a competitive mentality who i...
_source.description:
Job Summary:

As an Agency Sales Director (SD), you will be a passionate overachiever with an entrepreneurial spirit and a competitive mentality who isn’t afraid to work aggressively every day to forge new ground with our Agency accounts. Spredfast is a rapidly growing company, and our agency team is tasked with selling our best in class products to agencies that want to stay on the cutting edge of social. You will be responsible for driving day to day sales activities that allow us to grow revenue is this specific vertical market.

Above all else, we’re looking for a unique individual who will have fun and inspire others while slaying all the dragons associated with a fast-paced company and this emerging territory. If you think this sounds like a challenge fit for a superhero that couldn’t possibly exist – this probably isn’t the position for you. If this has you pumping your superhero fists in the air, then we invite you to apply. We look forward to meeting you. 

Responsibilities:

  • Passion around selling our multi-module, single platform high quality accounts in the Agency space.
  • Hunter mentality - this role is focused on acquiring new logos. (not renewals)
  • Evangelize Spredfast’s platform and unique capabilities.
  • Be adept at cultivating, evaluating, and negotiating sound agreements including legal provisions.
  • Manage and provide transparency and visibility into an accurate pipeline.
  • Show a high degree of self-motivation and work well both as an individual and within team environment.
  • Manage a highly consultative sales cycle.
  • Work closely with prospective clients to understand their business objectives and create the most appropriate solution to meet their needs.
  • Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets.

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience in an Inside/Full-Cycle Sales role and/or Agency Sales role.
  • Bachelor Degree (or equivalent); is great but not a requirement.
  • French and/or German language skills are an advantage but not a requirement.
  • Proven success in developing new business and managing sales cycle, from generating leads to closing deals.
  • Demonstrated history of quota attainment
  • Can work independently and manage time
  • Proven track record of penetrating and expanding accounts.
  • Ability to evaluate sound business opportunities and close new business.
  • A strong understanding of both social software and online marketing is preferred.
  • Ability to interact at all levels of organization.
  • Ability to handle multiple priorities and demands in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and successfully implement strategies and manage change.

The Perks at Spredfast

  • Flexible paid time off
  • New Mac laptops provided for all new employees
  • Mobile phone allowances
  • Competitive compensation and equity package

About Spredfast:

Spredfast is a social software company and platform, headquartered in Austin, Texas with offices in New York City, London, Madison, Wisconsin, and Sydney, that seeks to connect every company in the world with the people that they care about the most. Spredfast’s “Smart Social” software enables companies to manage, integrate, and amplify social content across any digital touch point. With global reach, Spredfast customers have managed more than one billion social connections across 84 countries. Today, Spredfast helps more than fifty percent of Interbrand’s 2015 World’s Best Brands to create first-class social experiences.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:  

Spredfast, Inc. is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails.  All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Spredfast via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Spredfast.  No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Spredfast as a result of the referral or through other means.

Notice to Applicants:  

We reserve the right to research relevant facts about you which are public on social media platforms or other sources over the Internet.  We will retain such data only as long as reasonably needed.

_source.title: Lead Technical Developer (UK)
_source.description_short: We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity that is cognitive computing. The convergence of data and technology is transforming industrie...
_source.description:
We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity that is cognitive computing. The convergence of data and technology is transforming industries, society and even the workplace. CognitiveScale is a high-energy, high-growth company funded by entities such as IBM, Intel, Microsoft and Norwest.  We are seeking an enterprising individual to join our growing team as a Technical Lead in our UK office.

 

What you will do everyday:

  • Lead collaboration efforts on solution design, work estimation and implementation of new features including interfaces, contracts with storage system and data transformation
  • Mentor and share knowledge with team members
  • Plan by understanding the details (effort, risk, priority) of remaining work committed for a release

  • Plan and execute an incremental and iterative software development process   

  • Perform peer code reviews as part of everyday workflow

  • Work with Customer and CognitiveScale project leadership to ensure implementation of CognitiveScale products and services are delivered on time and on budget.
  • Contribute ideas to continually improve the team’s productivity, job enjoyment, and code quality

 What you need to bring to the table:

  • 8+ years of experience in Object Oriented Design and Programming or Functional Programming
  • 5+ year of experience with Java, C#, Python, or Scala
  • A passion for learning and continuously honing your craft
  • Extensive experience with enterprise architecture, design patterns, distributed systems and microservices architectures
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively establish and maintain working relationships with all levels of the organization
  • Ability to recognize areas for improvement (whether tools, practices, etc.) and the initiative to work toward a solution
  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher. Computer Science, Maths, or Engineering major is preferable.

 What else will help:

The following specific skillsets are required;

Strong computer science fundamentals in data structures, algorithms, object-oriented programming and MVC architecture

Experience in end-to-end full-stack web/app development (you should have worked in at least one frontend framework: mobile or web based, one server side application framework with a database, SQL or otherwise and be able to deploy it to a barebones server)

Highly proficient in MicroServices/SOA Interoperability and an understanding of Rules Engine/Frameworks

Proficient in javascript (with an understanding of multiple frameworks like Angular, ReactJS, jQuery etc.), HTML and CSS, understanding of UX principles 

Willing to dabble and pick up new technologies which fit the "right tool for the job" paradigm

Working knowledge of Continuous Integration (CI) platforms (CircleCI) and Source Control systems (Git)      

Major brownie points for having a working knowledge of NLP/ML techniques

Demonstrated ability to rapidly adapt to new technologies and quickly contribute to a world-class engineering team that delivers high-quality code, consistently  

The ability to quickly estimate effort, analyze and solve problems, make difficult decisions, and take ownership of a problem from beginning to end 

Strong verbal and written communication skills (both technically and non-technically)       

Enjoy the challenge of troubleshooting data issues    

Know and can articulate the difference between spaghetti code and a well architected application    

May not have the right answer but you definitely know what to ask to get it, most importantly have the technical know how and a desire to learn  

Persistent and tenacious problem solver       

Skilled in writing efficient queries to backend databases like MySQL and PostgreSQL, Mongo   Experience of formal design methods and languages   

Experience working with large transactional data streams and combining transactional data with web, social and mobile data streams    

CognitiveScale is an Equal Opportunity Employer. CognitiveScale does not discriminate against any applicant for employment because of age, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, or disability.

_source.title: Experienced Brokers (Chicago)
_source.description_short: Do you have 2+ years of experience in a 3PL setting? Are you ready to join a winning team? Let's get the conversation started. Whether you are looking...
_source.description:
Do you have 2+ years of experience in a 3PL setting? Are you ready to join a winning team? Let's get the conversation started.

Whether you are looking to build a new book of business, manage a group of young sales reps, or focus on the operations of our existing accounts, we have an opportunity for you to take your career to the next level. Submit your resume and we will be in touch to discuss an option that best fits your skill set and long-term goals.

Possible opportunities include:

  • Sr. Customer Sales Representative (2+ years of experience)
  • Sr. Carrier Sales Representative (2+ years of experience)
  • Carrier Sales Manager (3+ years of experience)
  • Carrier Operations Manager (2+ years of experience)

_source.title: Regional Sales Manager
_source.description_short: We’re looking for a Regional Sales Manager to grow our sales team and help our Regional Account Executives bring the best local and regional merchants...
_source.description:
We’re looking for a Regional Sales Manager to grow our sales team and help our Regional Account Executives bring the best local and regional merchants in Texas on to DoorDash’s platform.

Your job as a Regional Sales Manager will have two central focuses. The first will be to support our local sales team in making favorite local merchants available for delivery on DoorDash. The second will be to grow and train the team to ensure that regional sales goals are exceeded.

What you’ll do

  • Grow the team — source, interview, and hire top sales personnel
  • Assist on important deals — the best Regional Sales Managers play a supporting role to their direct reports in many different ways, from prospecting the top new restaurant groups to sourcing the decision maker to creating the sales deck and helping with the close.
  • Integrate with the region — our sales team has ownership over most of our revenue-based regional goals, and it is up to the Regional Sales Manager to make sure their team is properly staffed and AEs are executing to hit these goals.
  • Scale learnings —  establish best practices for how to effectively manage a sales team and their book of business  and develop and implement new sales initiatives, strategies and programs to help increase your team’s productivity
  • Assess the strengths and weaknesses of your team and manage accordingly
  • Provide weekly and monthly performance reports with your team

About you

  • High-energy and fearless — you’ll do whatever it takes to win
  • Self-starter — you have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment
  • Natural leader — you pride yourself on your ability to lead and motivate a team
  • Self-motivated — you are able to work with minimal supervision while achieving daily, weekly, and monthly goals
  • Problem solver — you can independently translate high-level goals into actionable plans

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of sales experience with a track record of being a top performer
  • 3+ years of sales management experience; high-growth or early-stage start-up experience is a plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Nice to haves

  • Experience with Salesforce
  • Experience with Excel and PowerPoint (Google Apps and Keynote are great as well!)

About us

Today, we’re one of the fastest, most reliable food delivery platforms in North America. But that’s just the tip of the iceberg. We want to share our revolutionary logistics technology with every business around the world, to streamline how our cities and local economies work. Make no mistake, it isn’t going to be easy, and our mission isn’t for the faint of heart. But if you’re daring, and you want to make a dent, let’s chat.

_source.title: Sr. Technical Project Manager (Omni-Channel Team)
_source.description_short: Do you thrive at leading cross-functional teams? Have you mastered continuously improving and managing Agile development teams and enjoy the challenge...
_source.description:
Do you thrive at leading cross-functional teams? Have you mastered continuously improving and managing Agile development teams and enjoy the challenge of working in a fast-paced space like e-commerce? Are you a go-getter who loves to get stuff done and is passionate about delivering value to end users? If so, BigCommerce, a winner of Great Place to Work, Austin has an opportunity just for you!

We’re in search of Sr. Technical Project Manager for our Austin office to work with our local software development teams and global stakeholders in product, marketing, and sales.

Our PMO team leads projects/programs across the company, from Product Development to Marketing to Sales and everywhere in-between. You’ll be collaborating with both internal customers and external partners to help define and execute on our global roadmap.

What You’ll Do

  • Fluent as a Scrum Master, facilitating sprint planning, standups, sprint reviews, retrospectives and release planning.
  • Removing impediments and creating a culture for teams to be able to deliver at their best.
  • Flex your project management skills in scope management, proactive risks and issues management, cross-functional/stakeholder and leadership communication.
  • Drive projects from start to finish and deliver value to our merchants on time, within budget and scope.
  • Create and enforce cross-functional accountability across all business and technical groups & levels using soft and hard levers.
  • Lead and inspire your team’s - influence everyone around you.
  • Collaborate with colleagues within our PMO and across all other functions - both technical and not-so-technical counterparts.
  • Use a variety of tools like JIRA, Confluence and Google Apps.
  • Contribute to our company culture and collective best practices.

Who You Are

  • 5+ years experience in web-technologies, a technical project manager leading medium to large software development projects.
  • Project management, Agile development, process improvement/quality certifications are (e.g. Scrum Master, PMP, Lean or Six Sigma) preferred.
  • Experience working on e-commerce development teams
  • Direct experience. You have experience using Agile methodologies for managing projects and coaching teams.
  • Self-driven. You have superior organizational skills, integrity and great follow-through on tasks. You don't get overwhelmed easily.
  • Naturally curious. You're innovative, extremely creative and constantly providing ideas to optimise the process.
  • Fun. You're a charismatic people person who can talk to anyone; you're flexible, fearless, and excited to help build something awesome.
  • Pragmatic. You understand the awesomeness and downfalls of Agile, waterfall, and other philosophies & methodologies - and know what to apply for each situation.
  • Motivated. You understand the impact of a highly-satisfied, excited crew; you are slightly obsessive-compulsive about grinding away at issues.
  • Positive.  You know that when like-minded, talented colleagues put their minds to achieving ambitious goals, great things happen.  You bring that positivity & attitude to everything you do.
  • Problem Solver. You use logic, as well as imagination, to make sense of a situation and come up with an intelligent solution.
  • Roll Up Your Sleeves.  You have an innate, scrappy and entrepreneurial drive to get things done in a fast-moving environment where things can (and do!) change quickly, priorities compete, and you may not always have all of the details up front.  Nothing gets by you.
  • A utility player. You're willing to help out wherever needed.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent.

_source.title: Account Executive - Austin
_source.description_short: Marin Software is seeking an Account Executive who will be responsible for quota attainment and sales efforts based in our Austin office. They will...
_source.description:
Marin Software is seeking an Account Executive who will be responsible for quota attainment and sales efforts based in our Austin office. They will work closely with prospective clients to uncover requirements, assess the state of current SEM programs and develop sales strategies to win new business.

Responsibilities

  • Define the strategy and be responsible for the execution of overall sales to a prospect
  • Model the value and total cost of ownership of Marin Software
  • Direct cross-functional company resources required to support prospects needs based on potential revenue and strategic impact
  • Deliver presentations and demonstrations to a diverse, enterprise-class audiences ranging from C-Level to Marketing Execs to Search Managers.
  • Gather customer technical requirements / details of environment for review and development of on-boarding strategy
  • Serve as a conduit of prospect-related product features to the product team for roadmap consideration
  • Manage sales-cycle and present our Paid Search Management application, Marin Search Marketer via the web and face to face
  • Forecast sales activity in CRM tool, while creating satisfied and reference able customers
  • Work with a monthly, quarterly and yearly quota
  • Develop and sustain knowledge of Marin Software’s offerings and associated technologies

Qualifications

  • 7-10 years of quota carrying experience online media, selling software or software-as-a-service
  • Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Search Marketing industry experience preferred
  • Ability to work in a fast pace, team environment
  • Strong computer skills, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, Power Point and Excel

Relevant Background

Experience in Search Engine Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, Online Marketing, eCommerce or Analytics.

 

Compensation

This is an on-site, full time salaried position located in our Austin office. Compensation depends on prior experience. Marin pays market-leading compensation and provides Equity participation, best in class comprehensive health plans including medical, vision and dental. In addition to generous PTO Marin reimburses 50% of monthly commuting costs for parking and/or mass transit up to the IRS limitations. Marin Software’s world headquarters is located in the financial district of San Francisco, with remote offices in Chicago, New York, Austin, and Portland. European headquarters are located in Dublin, with additional offices in London, Singapore, Paris, Hamburg, Sydney, Shanghai and Tokyo. This is a great opportunity to really make a big impact on a business which is highly ambitious and going through a highly exciting stage of our growth!

About Marin Software

Marin Software Incorporated (MRIN) provides a leading cross-channel advertising cloud for performance marketers to measure, manage and optimize more than $6 billion in annualized ad spend across the web and mobile devices. Offering an integrated SaaS platform for search, display and social advertising, Marin helps digital marketers improve financial performance, save time, and make better decisions. Advertisers use Marin to create, target, and convert precise audiences based on recent buying signals from users’ search, social and display interactions. Headquartered in San Francisco, with offices worldwide, Marin's technology powers advertising campaigns in more than 160 countries. For more information about Marin's products, please visit: http://www.marinsoftware.com/solutions/overview.

Marin Software embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to diversifying our workforce, we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, gender, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or disability status.

_source.title: Assistant Manager - The Domain
_source.description_short: Position: Assistant Manager      Ever wondered what it’s like behind the bubbles?  #lushcareers  Lush North America has been creating fresh and handma...
_source.description:
Position: Assistant Manager 

 

Ever wondered what it’s like behind the bubbles?  #lushcareers

Lush North America has been creating fresh and handmade cosmetics for the past 20 years- keeping our customers’ bathtubs and showers a little more magical through our retail shops across Canada and the US. We are dedicated to the practices of fair trade sourcing and supporting sustainable communities as well as giving back to organizations that can make a difference through our Charity Pot Program.

We are currently searching for a creative and dynamic leader to join our team as an Assistant Manager. As an Assistant Manager you bring Lush’s Leadership Practices into all elements of your business: Be Real, Be Curious, Lead Fearlessly, Adapt and Evolve, Grow Talent, and Live with Purpose. You take initiative to drive your own development and improve your practice of leadership and management to step into your future role as Store Manager.

 

 We Offer:

  • A fun and funky store atmosphere where individualism is encouraged
  • A 50% discount off all our products to keep you smelling and feeling fresh
  • An unconventional retail structure to support your entrepreneurial spirit
  • The opportunity for growth as Lush loves to promote from within
  • Three amazing manager meetings a year

Responsibilities:

Unique Customer Experience:

  • Customer Service: ensure a unique customer experience that makes every visitor feel welcome, meets their needs and makes their day.
  • Building the Brand: educate our customers on our brand values, and articulate our position on Fighting Animal Testing, Freshest Cosmetics, Ethical Buying, 100% Vegetarian, Handmade, and Naked Packaging.
  • Driving Sales: demonstrate strong business acumen and understanding of your business metrics and reports and how to impact them through behaviors on the floor.

Unique Staff Journey:

  • Development and Engagement: Help to engage the staff at every level of your business to ensure they are inspiring, motivated and building strong customer relationships.
  • Recruitment and Selection: Support the staffing of your shop with top-performing staff by working actively within your markets to network, recruit, hire and succession plan.

Operational Excellence:

  • Policies and Procedures: Support your Manager to run a tight ship in which your staff are aware and comply with company standards for time and attendance, product integrity, respectful workplace, and health and safety.
  • Stock and Inventory: Support the training of your inventory team to abide by fresh standards and rotation rules and manage ordering to ensure the right products, in the right amounts are in the store at the right times
  • Visuals and Merchandising: Identify and support development of your team to take pride in a clean and beautiful work environment and follow the merchandising and design standards.

Qualifications:

Required:

  •    1-3 years managing or supervising in a retail environment
  •    Ability to manage reporting systems, outlook, excel and MS word
  •    Can lift to 30 lbs; reasonable accommodations will be made for any employee when necessary
  •    Ability to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the shop

Preferred:

  •    Experience with consultation-based customer service models
  •    Ability to develop and train staff through positive coaching and feedback
  •    Strong time-management and planning practices
  •    Experience working in skincare or cosmetics
  •    Experience with fresh product, ordering and rotation

 

At Lush, we believe when we continue to foster a culture of inclusion and respect within a diverse workforce, we are doing our part in building a world where there is equal opportunity for all. We recruit from a variety of employment agencies, community groups, non-profits, and online social and job sites, and in our business practices, strive to leverage the gift that diversity brings.   
Lush North America unequivocally supports equal opportunity employment for all applicants regardless of religion, race, color, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ancestry, differently abled, adverse mental health, and other characteristics both defined, protected and enforced by the law under federal or provincial/state jurisdiction.

_source.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Audio
_source.description_short: We are looking for a senior software engineer with extensive experience in embedded Linux, system-on-a-chip (SoC) development and integration, streami...
_source.description:
We are looking for a senior software engineer with extensive experience in embedded Linux, system-on-a-chip (SoC) development and integration, streaming audio and video technologies, and lightweight consumer-oriented player systems such as Netflix, Hulu, or Amazon. You will be responsible for integrating audio support into our upcoming products. This includes both video sound tracks (AAC, Dolby Audio, and DTS, both stereo and multichannel), and sound effects from games and our user interface. You will work extensively with our SoC vendors to ensure their audio capabilities meet our high standards. This is a senior role with a high-level of visibility and you must have a proven track record of developing and porting software for new hardware platforms from prototype to mass production.

Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of relevant software development experience.
  • In-depth understanding of Linux, tools, libraries and open source development.
  • Extensive experience with C++/OOD and the ability to solve complex problems.
  • Extensive experience with digital audio formats, audio mixing, and A/V sync.
  • Ability to architect and implement new audio features like night listening mode, transcoding, and down-mixing.
  • Proven track record of success with embedded system development projects.
  • Solid grasp of hardware and the manufacturing process, especially audio-related outputs like microphone jacks, HDMI, and S/PDIF.
  • Ability to accurately estimate software tasks and work to schedule.
  • Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience.
  • Any experience with Dolby Audio certification is a plus.
#LI-FA1

_source.title: Inside Sales Representative
_source.description_short: About Main Street Hub:   Main Street Hub is the voice of more local businesses than any other company. Utilizing its proprietary technology, the compa...
_source.description:
About Main Street Hub:

Main Street Hub is the voice of more local businesses than any other company. Utilizing its proprietary technology, the company offers a unique “do-it-for-you” marketing platform that integrates social media, customer reviews, web, and email marketing to help local businesses get more customers and keep them coming back, while saving them valuable time. Their team of dedicated, bright, positive people from all backgrounds is on a mission to create thriving local economies and help merchants and customers discover community.

Backed by leading investors, Main Street Hub was founded in 2010 and has grown to a team of over 700 colleagues with offices in both Austin, Texas and New York. Main Street Hub provides an essential service for local businesses and has been named one of the fastest growing private companies in the U.S. by Inc. Magazine, the fastest growing startup in Austin by the Austin Business Journal, and a Top Workplace by the Austin American-Statesman. Main Street Hub currently has more than 10,000 local business customers and has published more than 8 million messages across the web.

Our mission is to create thriving local economies. Through technology, creativity, and service, we provide great local businesses across the country with a do-it-for-you solution that helps them drive results, at a price that works for them.

For more information on our culture, check out https://blog.mainstreethub.com/why-our-values-matter.

Are you passionate about selling and helping local businesses thrive? Do you want to be a part of a hard-working, winning team, where people love coming to work to sell amazing technology and products? Are you looking for an opportunity that has unlimited earning potential? We're building the best inside sales opportunity in the local space. Ready to grow with us?

What you'll do:

  • Reach out to awesome local businesses nationwide
  • Sell our unique product in a high-activity, high-energy environment
  • Build and manage your pipeline from cold calling to close in Salesforce.com, setting aggressive goals and achieving them
  • Develop top performer sales skills with our training and mentorship programs
  • Thrive with the support of your teammates in daily/weekly meetings and fun team challenges
  • Earn additional prizes by working hard and having fun!

What it takes to be successful:

  • Someone who lives our values 
  • Someone who wants to make a big impact for local businesses AND be part of a winning team
  • 1-3+ years sales experience in a high volume outbound sales role
  • Proven track record of exceeding monthly and quarterly sales goals
  • Cold calling and prospecting experience with a short (1-3 calls) sales cycle
  • A desire to develop and grow with an in-depth onboarding program and ongoing sales training cutting edge sales training and programs
  • Degree preferred

Benefits:

  • Mission-driven, values-based culture.
  • Competitive pay, unlimited commissions, residuals, and eligibility for stock options.
  • 15 days of paid time off, plus 8 company holidays.
  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision.
  • Paid parental leave.
  • 401(k).
  • Fun, casual, urban office environment.
  • Brand new office in the heart of downtown Austin.
  • Professional development and experience, including opportunities to grow your career, working for one of most ambitious companies in Austin.

_source.title: Sales Development Representative
_source.description_short: What we’re looking for:  Modernize is looking for a Sales Development Representative to help qualify and generate leads through outbound calling and e...
_source.description:
What we’re looking for:

Modernize is looking for a Sales Development Representative to help qualify and generate leads through outbound calling and emails. This position will work closely with our Marketing team to obtain the leads, and work on moving them through the pipeline before they are introduced to our Sales Team.

What you will be doing:

● Generate leads through target account selling, outbound prospecting, and calling on leads from multiple sources

● Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, and develop interest to stimulate opportunity

● Action activity levels of between 50 100 calls per day

● Schedule demos for sales team with qualified leads

● Track and input all activity in SalesForce.com

● Demonstrate thorough knowledge of Modernize solutions and values

● Remain knowledgeable and up-to-date on product, industry changes, and competitive landscape

● Follow up on a high volume of new leads in a timely manner

What you will need:

● 1 to 2 years experience in high volume outbound cold calling experience preferred, but not required

● Candidates with strong academic, extracurricular, and/or athletic accomplishments preferred

● Background or knowledge in home improvement a major plus

● Strong organizational skills

● Hunter mentality in seeking out new business

● Strong email and web search skills

● Desire to establish a career in sales

● Knowledge of Salesforce.com or other CRM system is a plus

Who you are:

● Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

● Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment

● Energetic, upbeat, tenacious team player

● Excellent verbal and written communications skills

_source.title: Tech Support & Solutions Engineer - Western Europe Hours
_source.description_short: About CodeLathe At CodeLathe, we are building the world’s most powerful unified file services platform that organizes enterprise data, enhances collab...
_source.description:
About CodeLathe

At CodeLathe, we are building the world’s most powerful unified file services platform that organizes enterprise data, enhances collaboration and productivity while providing ironclad data protection. Our product FileCloud is quickly becoming the standard in Enterprise File Services space and it is widely used Global 2000, Fortune 500 and world leading organizations in city, state and federal governments. We are based out of Austin, Texas, USA and looking for talented people from anywhere on the globe.

Our Vision 

Organize enterprise information and make it universally accessible! 

Top Ten Reasons to Join Us

  1. Work with a world class engineering team that is out to change the world
  2. Fast growing company with lots of growth opportunities
  3. Strong engineering, product and customer focused culture
  4. 100% Remote Job – Work comfortably from your home office and avoid the commute
  5. Unique, customer driven software development process
  6. Work on the most challenging technical problems – File Systems, Search, AI, Distributed Systems.
  7. Work on widely used cutting edge Tech Stack
  8. Gender diversity – Men (60%), Women (40%)
  9. Part of a huge 10+ Billion $ and growing market space
  10. Competitive compensation based on experience and location 

Responsibilities:

  • Answer technical questions about software installation, deployment and usage scenarios

  • Assist customers with installation and configuration of CodeLathe software

  • Work directly with customers to troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve technical issues with CodeLathe’s software
  • Assist Engineering teams by escalating, reproducing customer issues until a solution is reached
  • Add and improve technical documentation 

Required Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor’s Engineering degree with 2 or more years of professional technical support experience is required

  • Ability to work in USA and Europe time zones

  • Experience with Microsoft Windows Server OS Administration and Troubleshooting including Active Directory is required

  • Experience with Linux Administration and Troubleshooting is required

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Self-starter, highly motivated and works with little or no supervision

  • Genuinely passionate in helping others, takes ownership and pride in their job

Location: Remote
